topic: With the progress being made with AI in software engineering and the shear volume of code being generated from it, are software engineers going to become human code review drones?
outcome_reason: An exceptionally high-quality, tightly contested debate. The Promoter won the empirical, present-tense trajectory argument with measurable data on AI code volume, PR explosion, collapsing junior pipeline, and structural feedback loops. The Detractor won the philosophical and definitional argument: the creative act was always the design decision, not code-writing; the Promoter expanded 'review' to encompass all professional judgment, emptying the word of meaning; and historical precedent (Solow paradox, compiler revolution) predicts diversification, not narrowing. Both conceded key points, narrowing the gap to a draw.
